data:
Teaching MIKHAIL E RAIKH Professor raikh@physics.utah.edu 801-585-5017 MIKHAIL E RAIKH Professor Teaching Research Summary Current Courses Memberships in Professional Organizations Presentations Research Groups Languages Geographical Regions of Interest Professional Service Internal Service Honors & Awards Teaching Research Summary Current Courses Memberships in Professional Organizations Presentations Research Groups Languages Geographical Regions of Interest Professional Service Internal Service Honors & Awards Research Summary I am a theoretical physicist working in the field of disordered systems. Lately, my research interest had switched to spintronics, the field which studies spin transport and spin dynamics, e.g. magnetic resonance.
Actually, expertise with disordered systems allows one
to establish certain delicate features of spin dynamics in a random magnetic field. Education Habilitation,
Condensed Matter Physics,
Ioffe Institute of the Academy of Science of USSR.
Project: Fluctuation effects in semiconductors
